    • Method Detail

      • getAllCombinations

        public static java.util.Set<Assignment> getAllCombinations(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<Value>> valuesMatrix)
        Generates all possible assignment combinations from the set of values provided as parameters -- each variable being associated with a set of alternative values.

        NB: use with caution, computational complexity is exponential!

        Parameters:
        valuesMatrix - the set of values to combine
        Returns:
        the list of all possible combinations

      • getAllCombinations

        public static java.util.Set<Assignment> getAllCombinations(java.util.List<java.util.Set<Assignment>> allAssignments)
        Generates all combinations of assignments from the list

        NB: use with caution, computational complexity is exponential!

        Parameters:
        allAssignments - list of alternative assignments
        Returns:
        the generated combination of assignments

      • extractPossiblePairs

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<Value>> extractPossiblePairs(java.util.Set<Assignment> assignments)
        Returns the set of possible (variable,value) pairs used in the the set of assignments given as arguments.
        Parameters:
        assignments - the assignments from which to extract the pairs
        Returns:
        the extracted pairs

      • getPowerset

        public static <T> java.util.Set<java.util.Set<T>> getPowerset(java.util.Set<T> originalSet)
        Get the power set of the given set
        Parameters:
        originalSet - the original set
        Returns:
        its power set

      • getEstimatedNbCombinations

        public static int getEstimatedNbCombinations(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<Value>> valuesMatrix)
        Returns the estimated number (higher bound) of combinations for the set of variables and associated values given as argument.
        Parameters:
        valuesMatrix - the set of values to combine
        Returns:
        the higher bound on the number of possible combinations
